intro: Canthium gueinzii, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its spiny calyces and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture. Canthium gueinzii is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in savannah and woodland habitats.
